hero.title: West Bank Raids and Killings
hero.subtitle: Deadliest period since Second Intifada: 500+ Palestinians killed including journalist Shireen Abu Akleh

brief_summary: The period 2022-2023 marked the deadliest years for Palestinians in the occupied West Bank since the Second Intifada (2000-2005). According to UN and human rights organizations, Israeli forces killed over 500 Palestinians during this two-year period, including at least 78 children. The violence occurred primarily through near-nightly military raids into Palestinian cities, particularly Jenin and Nablus, which Israel dubbed 'Operation Break the Wave.' These operations began in March 2022 following attacks by Palestinians inside Israel that killed 19 Israelis. The UN Commission of Inquiry found Israeli forces used 'unnecessary and disproportionate force,' applied combat rules inappropriately to law enforcement situations, and committed unlawful killings. The most high-profile case was the May 11, 2022 killing of Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh‚Äîthe UN Commission concluded Israeli forces killed her intentionally or recklessly, violating her right to life. In 2022 alone, 220 Palestinians were killed (including 48 children), making it the deadliest year since 2006. The pattern continued in 2023 with 507 Palestinians killed by year's end including 127 children‚Äîthe deadliest year in recorded history according to Doctors Without Borders. Major incidents included the January 2023 Jenin raid (10 killed), February 2023 Nablus raid (11 killed), and July 2023 Jenin incursion (12 killed with aerial bombardment). The raids were characterized by excessive force, extrajudicial killings, obstruction of medical care, and attacks on clearly marked journalists and paramedics.

executiveSummary.title: Executive Summary

alert.text: UN Commission finding: 'Israel applies the framework governing conduct of hostilities to law enforcement operations in the West Bank, contrary to international law, resulting in civilians being killed and injured.'‚ÄîOctober 2023 report

paragraphs: The escalation began in spring 2022 following a series of attacks by Palestinians inside Israel that killed 19 Israelis between March 22 and May 7. Israel responded by launching 'Operation Break the Wave'‚Äînear-nightly military raids into West Bank cities and refugee camps, particularly Jenin and Nablus. These cities had become centers of renewed armed Palestinian resistance with the emergence of groups like the Jenin Brigades (founded September 2021), the Lions' Den in Nablus, and the Balata Brigades. The Israeli operations involved massive deployments of troops, bulldozers destroying infrastructure and roads, use of live ammunition in densely populated areas, and increasingly, aerial bombardment including drone strikes. By the end of 2022, 220 Palestinians had been killed including 48 children‚Äîthe highest annual toll since the Second Intifada ended in 2005.

The violence was not limited to armed confrontations. According to Middle East Eye's analysis, the majority of Palestinian casualties in 2022 were likely unarmed at the time of their death. At least 95 Palestinians were shot by Israeli soldiers as bystanders during army raids or while participating in anti-occupation demonstrations. Seven women and girls were killed, including 15-year-old Jana Zakarneh shot twice in the face while playing with her cat on her rooftop, and 15-year-old Fulla al-Masalma killed a day before her birthday. The most internationally significant killing was that of Shireen Abu Akleh, Al Jazeera's veteran Palestinian correspondent, shot in the head on May 11, 2022 while covering a raid in Jenin. Despite wearing a clearly marked PRESS vest and standing with other journalists, Abu Akleh was killed by Israeli fire. The UN Commission of Inquiry investigated and concluded 'on reasonable grounds that Israeli forces used lethal force without justification under international human rights law and, intentionally or recklessly, violated Abu Akleh's right to life.'

The violence intensified further in 2023. In January, a raid on Jenin killed 10 Palestinians including a 61-year-old woman shot through the neck while watching from her bedroom window. In February, 11 Palestinians were killed in Nablus including civilians shot in the back while fleeing. In July, Israel conducted its largest West Bank operation in 20 years‚Äîa 14-hour assault on Jenin refugee camp using drones, helicopter gunships, and hundreds of troops, killing 12 and forcing 500 families to flee. By December 2023, Doctors Without Borders declared it 'the deadliest year for Palestinians in the West Bank in recorded history' with 507 killed including 127 children. The UN Commission found Israeli forces systematically violated international law by applying combat rules to law enforcement situations, using disproportionate force, failing to distinguish between civilians and combatants, obstructing medical care, and conducting what amounted to extrajudicial executions. Meanwhile, settler violence also surged‚Äîthe UN recorded over 800 settler attacks on Palestinians between October 2022 and May 2024, often occurring with Israeli military acquiescence or participation.

events.title: Palestinian attacks inside Israel
events.description: Series of attacks by Palestinians kill 19 Israelis including knife attack in Be'er Sheva (4 killed), shooting in Bnei Brak (5 killed), axe attack in Elad (3 killed), shooting in Tel Aviv (3 killed). Attackers from West Bank or Israel. Triggers Israeli Operation Break the Wave.

events.title: Operation Break the Wave begins
events.description: Israel launches military campaign of near-nightly raids into West Bank cities, particularly Jenin and Nablus. Focus on dismantling armed resistance groups. Massive escalation in use of force, arrests, home demolitions.

events.title: Shireen Abu Akleh killed
events.description: Al Jazeera's veteran Palestinian correspondent shot in head while covering IDF raid in Jenin. Wearing clearly marked PRESS vest, standing with other journalists. UN Commission later concludes Israeli forces killed her intentionally or recklessly, violating right to life. Her killing sparks international outcry.

events.title: Deadliest year since 2006
events.description: By year's end, 220 Palestinians killed in occupied territories (167 West Bank/E. Jerusalem, 53 Gaza). 48 children among dead. Over 9,000 injured. UN declares deadliest year since Second Intifada. Focus on Jenin (45 killed) and Nablus (45 killed) combined.

events.title: Jenin raid - 10 killed
events.description: Massive Israeli raid on Jenin kills 10 Palestinians. Majida Obaid (61) shot through neck while watching from bedroom window. Wasim Abu Jaes (16) crushed to death by military vehicle. Israeli forces fire on ambulances, shoot tear gas at hospital pediatric ward. UN: 'dangerous trajectory of violence.'

events.title: Nablus raid - 11 killed, 102 injured
events.description: Large-scale raid on Nablus kills 11, injures 102 (82 by live fire). Amateur video shows two men shot in back while fleeing. Palestinian Authority suspends security coordination with Israel in response, calling it 'massacre.' By this date, 61 Palestinians killed in 2023‚Äîdouble 2022 rate.

events.title: Jenin incursion - aerial bombardment
events.description: Largest West Bank operation in 20 years. Israel deploys drones, helicopters, 500+ troops in 14-hour assault on Jenin refugee camp. Twelve Palestinians killed, 100 injured, 500 families forced to flee homes. First extensive use of aerial force in West Bank since Second Intifada. IDF soldier also killed by friendly fire.

events.title: Pattern of unlawful killings continues
events.description: UN OCHA documents multiple raids. May 22: Balata camp raid kills 3, video shows one shot in back while fleeing. May 29: Jenin raid kills 1. By May 29, 112 Palestinians killed in 2023‚Äîmore than double 2022 rate. Medical personnel repeatedly obstructed.

events.title: Gaza war triggers massive West Bank escalation
events.description: After Oct 7 Hamas attack, Israeli operations in West Bank intensify dramatically. By Dec 2023: 507 Palestinians killed in 2023 (127 children). First use of airstrikes on mosques (Oct 22). Use of drones becomes routine. Over 10,000 Palestinians arrested. 800+ settler attacks documented. Doctors Without Borders: 'deadliest year in recorded history.'

events.title: UN Commission releases report
events.description: UN Independent Commission of Inquiry issues report (covering May 2021-Aug 2023). Key finding: 'Israel applies framework governing conduct of hostilities to law enforcement operations in West Bank, contrary to international law, resulting in civilians being killed and injured.' Jenin 2023 operations 'appear to have included unnecessary and disproportionate force.'

events.title: Hospital raid - commandos disguised as medical staff
events.description: Israeli commandos disguised as medical workers and Muslim women enter hospital in Jenin, shoot dead three Palestinians inside. UN experts: may amount to war crimes. War crime to impersonate medical personnel and to kill wounded even if militants.

alert.text: UN Commission: 'Israel applies the framework governing conduct of hostilities to law enforcement operations in the West Bank, contrary to international law, resulting in civilians being killed and injured.'‚ÄîOctober 2023

crimes.title: Unlawful Killing of Journalist Shireen Abu Akleh
crimes.description: May 11, 2022: Al Jazeera correspondent shot in head while covering Jenin raid. Wearing clearly marked PRESS vest, standing with journalists. UN Commission concluded 'on reasonable grounds that Israeli forces used lethal force without justification under international human rights law and, intentionally or recklessly, violated Abu Akleh's right to life.' Identified Duvdevan Unit as likely responsible. Intentional or reckless killing of clearly marked journalist is war crime.

crimes.title: Extrajudicial Executions
crimes.description: Palestinians accuse Israeli forces of assassination policy targeting armed group leaders. In three incidents in 2022, Israeli forces fatally shot 9 Palestinian fighters while inside vehicles in what Palestinians called 'field executions.' Pattern of targeted killings without arrest attempts. Video from Feb 2023 Nablus shows two men shot in back while fleeing‚Äîindicative of willful killing.

crimes.title: Unnecessary and Disproportionate Force
crimes.description: UN Commission concluded several 2023 Jenin operations 'appear to have included use of unnecessary and disproportionate force by Israeli security forces.' Includes use of drones, helicopters, hundreds of troops in densely populated refugee camps. Artillery-like force in law enforcement context violates international human rights law.

crimes.title: Killing of 78+ Children
crimes.description: At least 78 children killed 2022-2023 including many unarmed bystanders. Jana Zakarneh (15) shot twice in face while playing with cat on rooftop. Mahmoud Samoudi (12) shot during raid. Zaid Ghonaim (15) shot while hiding in parking garage. Wasim Abu Jaes (16) crushed by military vehicle. Willful killing of children violates Fourth Geneva Convention Article 147.

crimes.title: Obstruction of Medical Care
crimes.description: Systematic pattern of Israeli forces firing on ambulances, preventing medical personnel from reaching wounded, delaying evacuations. Jan 2023 Jenin: ambulances fired upon, tear gas shot at hospital pediatric ward. May 2023: medical sources report forces restricted ambulance movement. Denying medical care to wounded violates Geneva Conventions.

crimes.title: Hospital Raid with Perfidy (War Crime)
crimes.description: January 2024: Israeli commandos disguised as medical staff and Muslim women entered Jenin hospital, shot dead three Palestinians inside. UN experts: may amount to war crimes. Perfidy (feigning protected status to kill) explicitly prohibited under Geneva Conventions Additional Protocol I Article 37. Killing wounded even if militants also violates IHL.

crimes.title: Misapplication of Legal Framework
crimes.description: UN Commission finding: Israel applies combat rules (IHL conduct of hostilities) to law enforcement situations in West Bank, contrary to international law. This results in use of lethal force not justified under human rights law governing law enforcement. Systematic policy decision enabling unlawful killings.

crimes.title: Destruction of Civilian Property
crimes.description: Systematic use of bulldozers to destroy roads, infrastructure, homes during raids. July 2023 Jenin: massive destruction of refugee camp infrastructure. Pattern of destruction far exceeding military necessity. Extensive destruction not justified by military operations is grave breach under Fourth Geneva Convention Article 147.

international_law.title: International Law Framework
international_law.introduction: West Bank killings occurred under framework of international human rights law (governing law enforcement) and international humanitarian law (governing occupation). UN Commission found systematic violations of both.

sections.heading: Misapplication of Legal Framework - Core Violation
violations: Law Enforcement vs. Conduct of Hostilities: UN Commission determined Israel unlawfully applies IHL rules on conduct of hostilities to law enforcement in West Bank. Correct framework is international human rights law which strictly limits use of lethal force.

Right to Life (ICCPR Article 6): Lethal force only permissible when 'strictly necessary' to protect against imminent threat to life. UN found Israeli forces killed civilians not posing such threats‚Äîviolations of right to life.

Basic Principles on Use of Force and Firearms (1990): 'Intentional lethal use of firearms may only be made when strictly unavoidable in order to protect life.' Majority of West Bank killings do not meet this standard.
Systematic Policy: Misapplication of legal framework is policy decision by Israeli government, not error. Enables systematic unlawful killings across entire territory.

sections.heading: International Humanitarian Law Violations
violations: Fourth Geneva Convention Article 27: Protected persons 'shall be treated humanely...protected against all acts of violence.' Killing of 78+ children, journalists, medical obstruction violate this core protection.

Article 147 (Grave Breaches): 'Wilful killing...wilfully causing great suffering...extensive destruction...not justified by military necessity' are grave breaches. 500+ killings, property destruction meet threshold.
Protection of Journalists: Additional Protocol I Article 79 protects journalists as civilians. Killing of Shireen Abu Akleh‚Äîclearly marked press‚Äîis grave breach.

Perfidy Prohibition: Additional Protocol I Article 37 prohibits feigning protected status to kill. January 2024 hospital raid with commandos disguised as medical staff constitutes perfidy‚Äîwar crime.

sections.heading: UN Commission Findings (October 2023)
violations: Shireen Abu Akleh: Commission found 'on reasonable grounds that Israeli forces used lethal force without justification...and, intentionally or recklessly, violated Abu Akleh's right to life.'
Jenin Operations: Several 2023 operations 'appear to have included unnecessary and disproportionate force.' Use of drones, helicopters in densely populated areas violates proportionality.

Pattern of Violations: 'Israel applies framework governing conduct of hostilities to law enforcement operations in West Bank, contrary to international law, resulting in civilians being killed and injured.'
Settler Violence: Commission documented increase in settler attacks on Palestinians, often with Israeli military acquiescence or participation‚ÄîState responsibility for violations.

sections.heading: Specific Protected Persons Violations
violations: Children: Convention on Rights of Child and Fourth Geneva Convention Article 24 provide special protection. Killing 78+ children, many unarmed, violates these protections.
Medical Personnel: Geneva Conventions require protection of medical workers. Firing on ambulances, obstructing care, tear-gassing hospital violate absolute protections.
Wounded: Even wounded combatants protected once hors de combat. January 2024 hospital killings of wounded violate Common Article 3.
Women and Families: Majida Obaid (61) shot in neck watching from window; Fulla al-Masalma (15) killed day before birthday‚Äîdemonstrate indiscriminate nature of force.

sections.heading: Accountability Requirements
violations: Duty to Investigate: Geneva Conventions require States investigate grave breaches. Israel has systematically failed to conduct meaningful investigations.
Command Responsibility: Senior military and political officials who knew or should have known of violations and failed to prevent/punish may bear criminal responsibility.
ICC Jurisdiction: International Criminal Court has jurisdiction over situation in Palestine. West Bank killings fall within investigation.
State Responsibility: Israel bears State responsibility for violations by its forces and for settler violence it fails to prevent.

alert.text: Impunity: Despite 500+ Palestinians killed and UN findings of systematic violations, Israel has conducted virtually no meaningful investigations. Pattern of total impunity continues.

witnesses.name: Navi Pillay
witnesses.testimony: In presenting October 2023 report: 'Israel applies the framework governing conduct of hostilities to law enforcement operations in the West Bank, contrary to international law, resulting in civilians being killed and injured. The Commission has documented alarming trends in Israeli security forces' use of force...The operations in Jenin in 2023 appear to have included the use of unnecessary and disproportionate force.'

witnesses.name: Shatha Zakarneh
witnesses.testimony: Describing daughter's killing: 'Jana was on our roof playing with her cat. She wasn't protesting, she wasn't near any fighting. An Israeli sniper shot her twice in the face. My daughter was just a child playing with her pet. How can they say she was a threat? They killed her for no reason except that she was Palestinian.' Jana died January 2023.
witnesses.source: Family testimony to media and human rights organizations

witnesses.name: Al Jazeera (institutional)
witnesses.testimony: Statement after Shireen Abu Akleh's killing: 'We hold the Israeli government and the Israeli occupation forces responsible for the killing of Shireen. We call on the international community to condemn and hold the Israeli occupation forces accountable for deliberately targeting and killing our colleague.' Emphasized she was clearly marked as press.

witnesses.name: Ant√≥nio Guterres
witnesses.testimony: After January 2023 Jenin raid: 'I am deeply concerned by the dangerous trajectory of the violence in the occupied West Bank...The level of violence is shocking. Israeli security operations and Palestinian attacks are on the increase. I call on all to avoid further escalation.' Later: 'We continue to see a pattern of Israeli forces using lethal force unnecessarily.'

witnesses.name: Doctors Without Borders (M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res)
witnesses.testimony: December 2023 statement: 'In 2023, we witnessed the deadliest year for Palestinians in the West Bank in recorded history...The violence has deeply traumatized communities. Our teams treat patients with gunshot wounds almost daily. Israeli forces repeatedly obstruct medical care, fire near ambulances, and create an environment where providing healthcare is increasingly dangerous.'

witnesses.name: Wafa Obaid
witnesses.role: Daughter of Majida Obaid (61, killed Jan 2023)
witnesses.testimony: Describing mother's killing: 'My mother was in her bedroom, looking out the window at what was happening in the street during the raid. An Israeli sniper shot her through the neck. She was 61 years old, not a fighter, not a threat. Just a grandmother watching from her window. They killed her in her own home.' Majida died in January 2023 Jenin raid.

witnesses.name: B'Tselem (Israeli human rights organization)
witnesses.testimony: Statement on 2022 violence: 'The death toll in the West Bank and Gaza Strip is the highest since 2006...Israel's open-fire policy in the West Bank allows security forces to use potentially lethal force even when their lives are not in danger. This policy turns every military activity and every Palestinian demonstration into a life-threatening situation for Palestinians.'

witnesses.name: UN Special Rapporteur on Palestine
witnesses.testimony: After hospital raid January 2024: 'Disguising military forces as medical workers and Muslim women to execute Palestinians inside a hospital may amount to war crimes. Under international humanitarian law, killing the wounded is prohibited. Using perfidy to kill is a war crime. The international community must act.'

witnesses.name: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas
witnesses.testimony: After February 2023 Nablus raid: 'What happened in Nablus is a massacre. We hold the Israeli occupation government fully responsible. We have decided to suspend security coordination with the Israeli side. The Israeli government is responsible for the dangerous escalation and its consequences.'

commanders.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
commanders.role: Prime Minister of Israel (2022-present in this period)
commanders.responsibility: Returned to power Dec 2022 with far-right coalition. Authorized Operation Break the Wave and subsequent escalations. Defended killings as counter-terrorism. Government rejected all international criticism and UN findings.

commanders.name: Yoav Gallant
commanders.responsibility: Oversaw military operations in West Bank during 2022-2023. Authorized major Jenin operations including July 2023 incursion with aerial bombardment. Defended use of force as proportionate.

commanders.name: Itamar Ben-Gvir
commanders.responsibility: Far-right minister overseeing police including Border Police conducting raids. Encouraged aggressive tactics. Distributed weapons to settlers. Previously convicted of incitement to racism and supporting terrorism.

commanders.name: Herzi Halevi
commanders.responsibility: Top military commander from January 2023. Oversaw major Jenin and Nablus operations. Made operational decisions including use of drones, helicopters in West Bank‚Äîunprecedented escalation in tactics.

commanders.name: Shireen Abu Akleh
commanders.responsibility: Veteran Al Jazeera correspondent covering Israeli-Palestinian conflict for two decades. Killed May 11, 2022 by Israeli forces while wearing clearly marked press vest. Became symbol of targeting of journalists. UN found her killing violated her right to life.

commanders.name: Navi Pillay
commanders.responsibility: Former UN High Commissioner for Human Rights. Led UN Commission investigation into violations. October 2023 report documented systematic Israeli violations including unlawful killings, misapplication of legal framework.

sources.title: Verified Sources & Documentation
sources.introduction: Primary sources include UN Commission of Inquiry, UN OCHA protection reports, B'Tselem documentation, human rights organizations, and investigative journalism.

alert.text: Methodology: Casualty figures compiled from UN OCHA, Palestinian Health Ministry, B'Tselem, and media reports. UN Commission conducted independent investigation including field visits, interviews, video analysis. October 2023 Gaza war significantly impacted 2023 totals.
